The Library has developed guides for the citation styles most commonly used within the University. Use of these guides is supported in the University Referencing advice: Guidelines for staff . Before starting your work, it is important to first consult your Subject Guide, lecturer, or tutor for the preferred citation style for each subject you undertake. APA 7

The PDF and I:Cite APA 7 resources have been replaced by the more intuitive APA 7 Referencing Style Guide. Remember to change any Bookmarks or links you have to the new URL. APA 7 Referencing Style Guide

Harvard WesternSydU Harvard WesternSydU Referencing Guide (PDF) Other supporting materials Harvard WesternSydU FAQs Harvard referencing videos I:Cite Harvard WesternSydU MLA 8 MLA 8 Referencing Guide (PDF) Other supporting materials MLA 8 FAQs MLA referencing videos Vancouver Vancouver Referencing Guide (PDF) Other supporting materials Vancouver FAQs Vancouver referencing videos I:Cite Vancouver Chicago 17 Chicago 17 Referencing Guide (PDF) Other supporting materials Chicago 17 FAQs Chicago referencing videos AGLC 4 AGLC 4 Referencing Guide (PDF) Other supporting materials Australian Guide to Legal Citation 4 (Courtesy of Melbourne University Law Review Association) AGLC referencing videos General Citation Guidelines How to Cite Cases These citation style guides are designed to cover the most commonly asked citation and referencing questions. Further support is available . RefQuest : An interactive, monster-fighting game to assist with learning about different referencing styles and when to use them. To assist in managing references and applying citation styles, try one of these tools recommended by the Library.
